title: website: font problems on Linux
body:
On weekly.golang.org, and when viewing the website generated by godoc -http, the page
renders incorrectly if the Microsoft TTF font package is not installed. I am using a
Linux distribution which does not include this font package in their supported package
repositories.

As seen in the attached screenshot, the search box appears below and overlapping the
"Help" button. Also, if I click the "Share" button under the
"Try Go" box on weekly.golang.org, the "Run" button that appears on
the page overlaps the "Go Playground" text.

This issue goes away if I install the MS font package manually. I think it is desirable
to have the page render correctly when users don't have the MS TTF fonts installed.

I am using hg tip.

The font packages I do have installed while still experiencing this issue are:
ttf-cheapskate
ttf-dejavu
ttf-droid
ttf-freefont
terminus-font
xorg-fonts-100dpi
xorg-fonts-75dpi
